results.title: The Loves of Carmen
results.brief_description: Produced by Rita Hayworth’s production company, Beckworth, ‘The Loves of Carmen’ is a dramatised version of Carmen which is based, not on Bizet’s opera, but on the story by Prosper Merimee. This is definitely a star vehicle for Hayworth - she sizzles in the role as the beautiful and fiesty Spanish gypsy. She is joined by Glenn Ford who plays the besotted Don Jose. The film is directed by Hayworth’s favourite director, Charles Vidor, and includes some colourful dance and musical scenes, although it is essentially dramatic and not a musical. Rita Hayworth’s father assisted with some of the choreography and her uncle and brother also appear in the film.

results.title: Mrs Brown = Her Majesty Mrs Brown
results.creator_credit: John Madden, Sarah Curtis, Ecosse Films, Mobil Masterpiece Theatre, WGBH (Boston) and BBC
results.brief_description: Set at the height of Victorian England, ‘Mrs Brown’ tells of the extraordinary relationship between a Queen and a commoner. Judi Dench gives a stunning performance (which was reflected by her Best Actress nomination), as Queen Victoria who begins a doomed, and ultimately tragic relationship with her servant, John Brown (Billy Connolly). Brown brings comfort and life to the Queen’s long period of mourning following the death of her husband, Albert. Where others failed to cheer her up, Brown succeeds, and in doing so secures the Queen’s respect and friendship. The Victorian court is suspicious of their leader’s new found happiness which forces the Queen and Brown to make some painful choices about their relationship, their own needs, and the monarchy. Cast includes Antony Sher, Geoffrey Palmer, Richard Pasco and David Westhead.

results.title: Simba
results.creator_credit: Brian Hurst, Peter de Sarigny and Group Film Productions
results.brief_description: Allan Howard (Dirk Bogarde) arrives in Kenya to join his brother on the farm; tragedy awaits him when he discovers that his brother has been brutally murdered by the nationalistic Mau Mau tribe. He finds solace, and eventually love with neighbour Mary Crawford (Virginia McKenna). Alan works with the local Police Inspector (Donald Sinden), and together they suspect that the local African doctor, known only as Simba, is the leader behind the Mau Mau terrorist attacks. They must now play a tense waiting game. Based on actual events that occurred to British settlers in Kenya in the 1950s.

results.title: North West Frontier = Flame over India
results.creator_credit: J Thompson, Mariel Hellman and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Captain Scott (Kenneth More), is commissioned by the British Governor of colonial India for a rescue mission to ensure the safe passage of a five year old Hindi prince and his American governess (Lauren Bacall) out of danger. To achieve this Scott must make a 300 mile journey to Kalapur. The mission is fraught with danger as they are travelling on an old and fragile train, and an assassin has made his way onto the train and is posing as an ally. Cast includes Herbert Lom, Wilfred Hyde-White and Ursula Jeans.

results.title: Ikiru = to live = living = doomed
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa, Shojiro Motoki and Tokyo Film
results.brief_description: ‘Ikiru’ is a departure from Kurosawa’s other work and presents a thoughtful and moving piece on life and death. The film opens with an x-ray detailing the stomach cancer of the main character, Kanji Watanabe. The image sets the premise of the piece but not necessarily the tone, which vacillates between hope and despair. Kanji’s physical and mental health is not only damaged by the cancer within, but as Kurosawa subtly suggests, is also contributed to by the inertia of Kanji’s civil service job and life in post-war Tokyo. The film is primarily concerned with Kanji’s struggle to accept his condition and the downwards spiral that drives him to self destructive behaviour. He eventually meets a girl who convinces him that he should spend his dying months doing good. This prompts him to seek approval for having a children’s playground built. The playground will provide a source of enjoyment to the children of the community as well as be an epitaph to good citizen Kanji. Cast includes Takashi Shimura, Nobuo Kaneko, Kyoko Seki and Miki Odagiri. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Heart of darkness
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Rick Rosenberg, Robert W. Christiansen and Turner Pictures
results.brief_description: This adaptation of Joseph Conrad’s classic tale features Tim Roth as Marlow, the British Captain travelling deep into the heart of Africa’s Congo River, and John Malkovich as the elusive Kurtz, a god to native tribes. It is a search that will take them deep into the evil darkness that lurks within the heart of man. Cast includes Tim Roth, John Malkovich, Isaach Bankole, James Fox and Morten Faldaas.

results.title: The Scent of green papaya = l'odeur de la papaye verte
results.creator_credit: Tran Anh Hung, Christophe Rossignon, La Sept Cinema, SFP Cinema and Productions Lazennec
results.brief_description: Vietnam, 1950. Mui, a young country girl, joins a Saigon family as their servant and develops an enduring but secret attachment to Khuyen (Vuong Hoa Hoi), a friend of the eldest son. Some years later, when the family fortune declines and they can no longer afford to keep her, Mui (Nu Yen-Khe Tran), now 20, is sent to serve in the household of her childhood love who has now become a successful musician. Shot entirely in a French studio, Hung’s film is more concerned with the minute details of everyday Vietnamese life and the tones, colors, and feelings of a lost society. Hung casted non-professional actors, mostly Vietnamese living in Paris, who had to re-learn certain ritual gestures and Vietnamese language. His approach to this gentle world is reminiscent of Satyajit Ray and Ozu. He nudges the film forward by subtle, quiet strokes. Awards: French Academy of Cinema (1993): best First Feature Film for Tran Anh Hung ; Cannes Film Festival: Camera d’Or for Best First Film. Cast includes Nu Yen-Khe Tran, Truong Thi Loc and Nguyen Anh Hoa. In Vietnamese with English subtitles.

results.title: The Parent trap
results.brief_description: A summer camp turns into a life altering adventure when two long lost twin sisters (both played by Hayley Mills), are reunited. Together the newly formed friends devise a fiendish plot to rekindle the romance between their separated parents and live as one happy family. With two minds on the job there’s double the chance of success! Cast includes Maureen O’Hara, Brian Keith, Charlie Ruggles and Una Merkel. Based on the novel ‘Das Doppelte lottchen’ by Erich Kastner.

results.title: Heat
results.creator_credit: Michael Mann, Art Linson, Regency Entertainment (USA) and Monarchy Enterprises B. V.
results.brief_description: Neil McCauley (Robert De Niro) is a professional. He is meticulous and cautious. He also is a professional robber. After a successful heist, LA cop Vincent Hanna (Al Pacino) is on McCauley’s trail and out to stop him. The two are soon caught in an epic battle and yet they recognise that they are actually essentialy the same. Michael Mann’s “Heat” is a rivetting action film which also attempts to examine in some depth the lives of the film’s characters, in particular Vincent and Neil as well as the other members of his team. By casting dynamic actors like De Niro and Pacino in the lead roles, as well as Val Kilmer and John Voight in supporting roles, the focus on character remains engaging in the midst of the explosive violence of the action sequences which drive the film along.

results.title: Up close & personal (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jon Avnet, Jordan Kerner, David Nicksay and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: From humble beginnings, Sally Atwater (Michelle Pfeiffer) is about to hit the big time. Arriving from a trailer park in Nevada, an overeager and overdressed weather girl, she makes a disastrous debut on national television. All is not lost however as her passion for the job captures the eye of the experienced, and handsome newsman, Warren Justice (Robert Redford). With Warren’s help Sally is transformed, Pygmalian style, into a popular and respected journalist. Along the way romance develops, but this is threatened by Sally’s newfound success and they must find a balance between love and their successful careers. Cast includes Stockard Channing, Joe Mantegna and Kate Nelligan.
